sentences.english: Brother L and H were in front of me at my sickbed that afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 手術後兩天，L弟兄與H弟兄出現在我的病榻前。

sentences.english: But the last thing I remember I was going to bed from my fatal illness on the Isle of Elba.
sentences.chinese: 但我最後的記憶就是在厄爾巴島的病榻上。

sentences.english: She watched beside her sick mother's bed for several nights.
sentences.chinese: 她在她母親的病榻旁守了好幾夜。

sentences.english: Was the bedside of such a dying man as that the proper place for a bishop?
sentences.chinese: 那種死人的病榻前也能成爲主教涉足的地方嗎？

sentences.english: He's bedridden throughout the year with a lingering, obstinate disease.
sentences.chinese: 他身患痼疾，常年纏綿病榻。

sentences.english: On his deathbed, the priest repented of his crime.
sentences.chinese: 病榻上，神父終於悔悟了。

sentences.english: Take people long on the sickbed have heart disease, he began to deliberately HUAFA temper.
sentences.chinese: 修民久臥病榻產生心病，他開始故意對大華髮脾氣。

sentences.english: Though a bedridden invalid, she remains optimistic about life.
sentences.chinese: 她雖是纏綿病榻的人，但對生活依然抱樂觀態度。

sentences.english: In the last few years I have never left my bed.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的幾年中，我從未離開過病榻。

sentences.english: King William had thrown off his illness, and returned to his normal life.
sentences.chinese: 威廉王已經撇開了病榻，恢復了正常的生活。

definition: on one's deathbed/at the point of death
to be critically ill/to be terminally ill
approaching one's end/with one foot in the grave
to be ill/to be in bad health
to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
lit. to fly on a crane to the Western Paradise/fig. to pass away (idiom)
to fall gravely ill, never to recover (idiom)
to fall ill/to be stricken with an illness
seriously ill and about to die
